page.title: 17Mr.William Orson
page.content: Mr.William(Bill) Orson is a local farmer whose family owned land in the village in the 18th.century.He has been a County Councillor and Melton Borough Councillor for 40 years. He was born in 1909 and one of his first memories is of the 1st.World War and escorting German P.O.Ws.from Long Clawson to Old Dalby to work on his father's farm. The high spot of the village year was then the Feast of St.John,the last Sunday in June.There were cricket matches,a fair,sports and village dances.The Feast usually came between hay making and the start of harvest. He can remember the first tractor used on a local farm in 1922.He still takes an active part in village life and has a fund of amusing stories about village life over the last 70 years.
